verses.verse: A Prayer <S%H8605><s%> of Moses <S%H4872><s%> the man <S%H376><s%> of God <S%H430><s%>. Lord <S%H136><s%>, thou hast been our dwelling place <S%H4583><s%> in all <S%H1755><s%> generations <S%H1755><s%>.

Before the mountains <S%H2022><s%> were brought forth <S%H3205><s%>, or ever thou hadst formed <S%H2342><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> and the world <S%H8398><s%>, even from everlasting <S%H5769><s%> to <S%H5704><s%> everlasting <S%H5769><s%>, thou art God <S%H410><s%>.
Thou turnest <S%H7725><s%> man <S%H582><s%> to destruction <S%H1793><s%>; and sayest <S%H559><s%>, Return <S%H7725><s%>, ye children <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%>.

For a thousand <S%H505><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> in thy sight <S%H5869><s%> are but as <S%H3117><s%> yesterday <S%H865><s%> when it is past <S%H5674><s%>, and as a watch <S%H821><s%> in the night <S%H3915><s%>.
Thou carriest them away as with a flood <S%H2229><s%>; they are as a sleep <S%H8142><s%>: in the morning <S%H1242><s%> they are like grass <S%H2682><s%> which groweth up <S%H2498><s%>.
In the morning <S%H1242><s%> it flourisheth <S%H6692><s%>, and groweth up <S%H2498><s%>; in the evening <S%H6153><s%> it is cut down <S%H4135><s%>, and withereth <S%H3001><s%>.
For we are consumed <S%H3615><s%> by thine anger <S%H639><s%>, and by thy wrath <S%H2534><s%> are we troubled <S%H926><s%>.
Thou hast set <S%H7896><s%> our iniquities <S%H5771><s%> before thee, our secret <S%H5956><s%> sins in the light <S%H3974><s%> of thy countenance <S%H6440><s%>.
For all our days <S%H3117><s%> are passed away <S%H6437><s%> in thy wrath <S%H5678><s%>: we spend <S%H3615><s%> our years <S%H8141><s%> as a tale <S%H1899><s%> that is told.

The days <S%H3117><s%> of our years <S%H8141><s%> are threescore <S%H7657><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> and ten <S%H7657><s%>; and if by reason of strength <S%H1369><s%> they be fourscore <S%H8084><s%> years <S%H8141><s%>, yet is their strength <S%H7296><s%> labour <S%H5999><s%> and sorrow <S%H205><s%>; for it is soon <S%H2440><s%> cut off <S%H1468><s%>, and we fly away <S%H5774><s%>.
Who knoweth <S%H3045><s%> the power <S%H5797><s%> of thine anger <S%H639><s%>? even according to thy fear <S%H3374><s%>, so is thy wrath <S%H5678><s%>.
So teach <S%H3045><s%> us to number <S%H4487><s%> our days <S%H3117><s%>, that we may apply <S%H935><s%> our hearts <S%H3824><s%> unto wisdom <S%H2451><s%>.
Return <S%H7725><s%>, O LORD <S%H3068><s%>, how long? and let it repent <S%H5162><s%> thee concerning thy servants <S%H5650><s%>.
O satisfy <S%H7646><s%> us early <S%H1242><s%> with thy mercy <S%H2617><s%>; that we may rejoice <S%H7442><s%> and be glad <S%H8055><s%> all our days <S%H3117><s%>.
Make us glad <S%H8055><s%> according to the days <S%H3117><s%> wherein thou hast afflicted <S%H6031><s%> us, and the years <S%H8141><s%> wherein we have seen <S%H7200><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%>.
Let thy work <S%H6467><s%> appear <S%H7200><s%> unto thy servants <S%H5650><s%>, and thy glory <S%H1926><s%> unto their children <S%H1121><s%>.

And let the beauty <S%H5278><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> our God <S%H430><s%> be upon us: and establish <S%H3559><s%> thou the work <S%H4639><s%> of our hands <S%H3027><s%> upon us; yea, the work <S%H4639><s%> of our hands <S%H3027><s%> establish <S%H3559><s%> thou it.
